meanings.definition: A North American diving duck with a sloping profile and a chestnut-red head.
meanings.sent1: The canvasbacks gracefully dove into the water to catch fish.
meanings.sent2: I saw a flock of canvasbacks swimming in the lake.
meanings.sent3: The canvasbacks decided to have a diving competition for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was as vibrant as a canvasback's chestnut-red head.
meanings.sent5: The canvasbacks' sloping profile made them easily recognizable among other ducks.

meanings.definition: A type of wild duck known for its delicious meat.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant served roasted canvasbacks for dinner.
meanings.sent2: Hunters often seek canvasbacks for their tasty meat.
meanings.sent3: The chef prepared a special dish using canvasbacks as the main ingredient.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the cooking canvasbacks filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The canvasbacks' meat was so succulent that it melted in your mouth.

meanings.definition: A type of duck decoy used in hunting.
meanings.sent1: The hunter placed the canvasbacks in the water to attract real ducks.
meanings.sent2: The canvasbacks were strategically positioned to lure the ducks closer.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dog mistook the canvasbacks for real ducks and tried to play with them.
meanings.sent4: The hunter's collection of canvasbacks was so realistic that even birds were fooled.
meanings.sent5: The canvasbacks' lifelike appearance made them effective decoys for hunting.
